result.execSummary:
The defendant Crystal O. Hill was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (<=1g), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.
  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (<=1g), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*   Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
*   Pay prosecution costs of $330.
May not have contact with Aubriela V or Mahogany Y, or any drug dealesr or drug users, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.

timeConds.notes:
Huber allowed.
Credit for 116 days.
Unless work crew is expressly prohibited by the court, an inmate serving time as a condition of probation is eligible for work crew and may receive a credit of one day for every 3 days of work performed.

supervisions.notes:
Probation Revoked.
Any unpd court obligations are still to be collected.
***AJOC - Court orders 41 additional days of sentence credit.***

superMiscConds.notes: Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.    Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  ***Including employment training and literacy programs***    May not have contact with known drug felons or dealers, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Amendment to Judgment of Conviction and Order-ERP, DOC-2259.  Def. has successfully completed the Earned Release Program.  It is ordered that DOC effectuate the change from confinement to extended supervision, determining the actual number of days served in confinement and changing the remaining confinement to extended supervision.  The number of days will be determined by DOC and be based upon actual release date.  Release to be effectuated within 6 working days upon receipt of this order.

No contact with known drug felons or dealers.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney H Edwards.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On ct 1 the court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 5 years w/conditions; 9 months conditional jail w/Huber privileges; credit for 116 days served; on ct 3 the court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 5 years w/conditions concurrent to ct 1; 9 months conditional jail w/Huber privileges; credit for 116 days served; on ct 4 the court imposes sentence of 30 days jail w/credit for time served; costs ordered, to be paid during period of probation on cts 1 & 3; deft to pay $700 DNA surcharge; pay $330 prosecution costs (by stipulation of deft).

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney H Edwards.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On State's motion, cts 2, 5 & 6 are dismissed and read in, the enhancers of on or near a school in cts 1 & 3 are dismissed.  Deft pleads guilty to cts 1, 3 & 4.  Court finds deft guilty of cts 1, 3 & 4.  PSI ordered.  DNA sample ordered.  SEH 6/5/15 at 9am.  Bond continued.

With Atty Edwards the FPT of 4/2/15 at 8:15am is rescheduled, as ADA Delgado had to miss their meeting and could not reschedule before today and Atty Edwards is in trial in Br 3 on this date; reset to 4/23/15 at 9am.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.
Waiver of right to preliminary hearing.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney H Edwards.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Edwards states they are not contesting the competency evaluation.  Deft agrees w/Dr's assessment.  Court finds that the deft is competent to proceed.  Deft waives the preliminary hearing.  Court accepts waiver of preliminary hearing.  State files information.  Atty Edwards acknowledges receipt and waives reading.  Deft enters not guilty pleas.  DA PTC 3/20/15 at 1:30pm and FPT 4/2/15 at 8:15am.  Bond continued.
John Pankiewicz, M.D.
Order CR 205 faxed to WFS and WCS notified.
Order for competency - form CR-205
Wrong crime listed on order for comp.  Not sent out.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. Hilary Edwards. Clerk LE. Case was scheduled for preliminary hearing this morning. Atty. Edwards raises issue of competency. Court orders competency evaluation under 971.14(2)(c) to be performed in-patient by the Milwaukee Forensic Unit. Exam to be completed and report filed in 15 days. Competency hearing on 3-10-15 @ 8:15am. Time limits tolled for preliminary hearing. Bond continued.
Hilary Edwards

Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; set before Commissioner on  2-18-15 @ 9:45 am.  Warrant vacated.  $2500 cash bond set with conditions.

*Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.
